Others: Chicago White Sox improved to 39-120, avoiding a record-breaking loss for the third straight day
Chris Flexen won his first game since May 8, ending a franchise record 23-game winless streak
The White Sox finished their home schedule with a 23-58 record
The Angels dropped to 63-96, setting a franchise record for losses in a season
The Angels had six hits in the game, with five off Flexen
The White Sox put it away with a season-high seven runs in the fifth inning
Zach Neto got hurt when he tried to take second on a pitch in the dirt in the fourth inning
Tyler Anderson permitted five runs, four earned, and four hits in 4 1/3 innings
